meta.description: Trait cards for Damn Nature You Scary evolution game

traits.name: Bilateral Symmetry
traits.grants: Foundation for most animal body plans
traits.science: Bilateral symmetry emerged ~555 MYA, enabling directed movement and cephalization

traits.name: Segmentation
traits.science: Segmentation allows specialization of body regions (tagmosis) and evolutionary flexibility

traits.name: Exoskeleton
traits.grants: +1 competition vs non-armored. Cannot be displaced by predators once per era.
traits.science: Chitin exoskeletons provide protection but require molting for growth

traits.name: Compound Eyes
traits.grants: Wide field of view, motion detection
traits.science: Compound eyes have thousands of ommatidia, excellent for detecting movement

traits.name: Trilobite Eyes
traits.science: Trilobite eyes were made of calcite crystal - the only known mineral-based lenses in nature

traits.name: Protective Shell
traits.science: Calcium carbonate shells first appeared in the Cambrian, driving the 'arms race' of evolution

traits.name: Gills
traits.grants: TILES: Ocean, Shallow Sea, Reef, Coast. +1 competition on aquatic tiles.
traits.science: Gills extract dissolved O2 via countercurrent exchange, ~80% efficient

traits.name: Notochord
traits.science: The notochord is a flexible rod providing skeletal support, precursor to the spine

traits.name: Vertebral Column
traits.science: Vertebrae replaced the notochord, enabling larger body sizes and complex movement

traits.name: Jaws
traits.science: Jaws evolved from gill arches ~430 MYA, revolutionizing feeding strategies

traits.name: Cartilaginous Skeleton
traits.science: Sharks and rays have cartilage skeletons - lighter than bone, requires less energy

traits.name: Bony Skeleton
traits.grants: Strong attachment for muscles, mineral storage
traits.science: Bone stores calcium and phosphorus, enables stronger muscle attachments

traits.name: Swim Bladder
traits.science: Swim bladder regulates buoyancy by adjusting gas volume - precursor to lungs

traits.name: Lobed Fins
traits.grants: Can prop up on fins, proto-walking
traits.science: Lobed fins contain bones homologous to tetrapod limbs - humerus, radius, ulna

traits.name: Lungs
traits.grants: TILES: Coast, Swamp (with Gills). Survive low-O2 water events. Required for land.
traits.science: Lungs evolved from swim bladders, enabling exploitation of atmospheric O2

traits.name: Tetrapod Limbs
traits.grants: TILES: All terrestrial (with Lungs). +1 competition on coastal tiles.
traits.science: First tetrapods like Tiktaalik (~375 MYA) bridged fish and amphibian body plans

traits.name: Moist Permeable Skin
traits.science: Amphibian skin supplements lung breathing but requires constant moisture

traits.name: Aquatic Eggs
traits.science: External fertilization in water - high fecundity but vulnerable eggs

traits.name: Broadcast Spawning
traits.science: Release millions of gametes into water - low survival but huge numbers

traits.name: Amniotic Egg
traits.grants: TILES: All terrestrial (no water needed). +1 marker on dry tiles (Desert, Plains).
traits.science: Amniotic membrane provides private pond for embryo - key terrestrial adaptation

traits.name: Reptilian Scales
traits.science: Keratinized scales prevent water loss - crucial for arid environments

traits.name: Ectothermy
traits.grants: Low energy needs, vulnerable to cold
traits.science: Body temperature depends on environment - efficient but limits activity in cold

traits.name: Endothermy
traits.grants: TILES: Polar, Tundra, Mountains. SAFE from ice ages. +2 competition in cold tiles.
traits.science: Internal heat production requires 10x more food but enables constant activity

traits.name: Fur
traits.grants: -1 cost to Endothermy. +1 competition in Tundra, Mountain tiles.
traits.science: Hair/fur traps air for insulation - evolved from sensory structures

traits.name: Mammary Glands
traits.science: Mammary glands evolved from modified sweat glands - optimal infant nutrition

traits.name: Live Birth (Viviparity)
traits.science: Internal development protects embryo but limits offspring number

traits.name: Placenta
traits.science: Placenta enables extended nutrient transfer - offspring born more developed

traits.name: Synapsid Skull
traits.science: Single temporal fenestra allows for larger jaw muscles - ancestor of mammals

traits.name: Diapsid Skull
traits.science: Two temporal fenestrae reduce skull weight - ancestor of reptiles, birds

traits.name: Upright Posture
traits.science: Legs under body rather than sprawled - enables sustained running

traits.name: Hollow Bones
traits.science: Pneumatic bones reduce weight while maintaining strength - essential for flight

traits.name: Feathers
traits.science: Feathers evolved for insulation/display before being co-opted for flight

traits.name: Powered Flight
traits.grants: MIGRATE: Move markers 2 tiles/era. ESCAPE: Cannot be displaced. TILES: All non-aquatic.
traits.science: Lift = 0.5 × ρ × v² × A × Cl. Requires ~10% body mass in flight muscles

traits.name: Insect Flight
traits.grants: Move to any tile (first flying animals)
traits.science: Insect wings evolved independently - possibly from gill-like structures

traits.name: Burrowing
traits.grants: SAFE during most extinctions, temperature stability
traits.science: Burrows provide thermal buffering and protection from surface catastrophes

traits.name: Nocturnal Adaptation
traits.grants: SAFE during K-Pg, avoid dinosaur competition
traits.science: Nocturnal lifestyle may have allowed early mammals to avoid dinosaur predation

traits.name: Small Size
traits.grants: SAFE from most extinctions. -1 cost to Burrowing. Max 2 markers per tile.
traits.science: Small organisms need less resources and have faster generation times

traits.name: Large Size
traits.grants: +2 in tile competition, DOOMED during extinctions
traits.science: Cope's Law: lineages tend toward larger size over time, but large size is risky

traits.name: Reef Dwelling
traits.grants: TILES: Reef only. +3 competition on reef tiles. DOOMED if reef tile flips to Ocean.
traits.science: Coral reefs are the 'rainforests of the sea' - extreme biodiversity, extreme fragility

traits.name: Deep Sea Adaptation
traits.science: Deep sea is buffered from surface changes - P = ρgh (pressure increases with depth)

traits.name: Freshwater Adaptation
traits.science: Freshwater systems often survive marine extinction events better

traits.name: Six Legs
traits.grants: TILES: All terrestrial. -2 cost to Insect Flight. +1 fecundity (many offspring).
traits.science: Six legs provide stable tripod gait - three legs always on ground

traits.name: Complete Metamorphosis
traits.grants: Larvae and adults exploit different niches
traits.science: Complete metamorphosis separates larval feeding from adult reproduction

traits.name: Eusociality
traits.science: Reproductive division of labor - workers forgo reproduction to help queen

traits.name: Pollination Behavior
traits.science: Coevolution with angiosperms - flowers provide nectar, insects provide pollen transfer

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.science: Range = (Emitted_Power / Detection_Threshold)^0.25 - up to 100m in some species

traits.name: Crocodilian Body Plan
traits.grants: Survive on land AND water tiles, SAFE during most extinctions
traits.science: Crocodilians are 'living fossils' - body plan unchanged for 200+ million years

traits.name: Venom
traits.science: Venom evolved independently 100+ times - modified saliva or skin secretions

traits.name: Arboreal Lifestyle
traits.science: Tree-dwelling requires grasping limbs and enhanced spatial awareness

traits.name: Opposable Digits
traits.science: Opposable thumbs enable precision grip - key to primate success

traits.name: Encephalization
traits.science: Brain tissue uses 20x more energy than muscle - expensive but powerful

traits.name: R-Strategy Reproduction
traits.science: Many offspring, little parental care - thrives in unstable environments

traits.name: K-Strategy Reproduction
traits.science: Few offspring, high parental investment - thrives in stable environments

traits.name: Parental Care
traits.science: Parental care increases offspring survival at cost of parent resources
